div.p: Elder daughter of Ernst Friedrich Karl Rudorff.

div.head: Career Summary
div.p: Elisabeth Rudorff devoted much of her life to campaigning for the protection of "nature and landscape" in Germany. Her concerns lay particularly with a hilltop range within the Weser Hills (Wesergebirge, North Rhine-Westphalia and Lower Saxony) named the "Lauenstein Ith" and the arable lands in its surrounding area.

div.head: Correspondence with Schenker
div.p: Elisabeth Rudorff wrote one letter to Schenker, OJ 13/36, [1], January 11, 1909, to which no reply from Schenker is known to survive; however, Schenker requested Universal Edition to forward to her his editions of keyboard works by C. P. E. Bach and organ concertos by Handel, to which UE's reply and confirmation is OC 52/34, January 14, 1909. She was also one of the signatories, together with her mother, Gertrud, and younger sister, Melusine, to the printed announcement of her father's death (OJ 13/36, [2], December 31, 1916).
